column4: ok here goes, I was trying to set up my modem, I found a ubuntu precompiled driver so I installed it.   It appears to have created 2.6.24-19, uname -r stated 2.6.24-18 .   I dug a little deeper and noticed the only file in the 19 folder is the driver.   Can I just copy the driver to 18 and delete 19 ?
you can't copy kernel modules from one version of a kernel to another like that
are you sure?  one is 2.6.24-18 and the other is 2.6.24-19 , uname -r shows 2.6.24-18  and and also all my other drivers are in -18 .   the only thing in -19 is the modem driver
what's the brand/model of your modem, and where did you get the precompiled driver?

the driver came form http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=471503  , the first post and my modem is Intel536ep.   I found out about this preconfiled driver on https://help.ubuntu.com/community/DialupModemHowto/Intel536EP#head-e726fc2d5f8541346dfd964f6d66c9ca0f061cc6
that package looks a little suspicious, did you install the deb with dpkg?
did you check the source of the driver?  they were the ones who pointed me to the compiled version
if you install the deb package and then try "sudo modprobe Intel536", it should work...
check your dmesg log to see if there's any output (don't paste here)
does it matter if it's not in the same kernel folder ?  as I mentioned uname reports 2.6.24-18  and the driver is located in 2.6.24-19
no, you must be looking at the wrong instructions. Download the deb here: http://www.mediafire.com/?gyw21am21wm then install it with dpkg

I am not looking at any instructions... I already downloaded and installed the driver but the driver was not loaded.  so I looked around and noticed the multiple kernel versions.  Do you see what I'm getting at.  If in install it again, won't it just create a 2.6.24-20
the deb file creates the folders 17,18,19,20 with the driver, but in reality they are all symlinked to one driver
so you're saying I don't have to copy the file into -18 since uname states I am using -18 and the driver does not appear in -18
unless you deleted something, the driver should be in the 18 folder, you need to manually load it: "sudo modprobe Intel536"
read above
you don't need to copy, it's symlinked, I already answered your question
there is no link in -18 for my modem, no symlinks, no regular links none. the only links for my modem are in -19 and now -20 since I reinstalled the driver per your earlier suggestion
I tried to install that package and it gave an error
for me I did not get an error

the deb package uses faulty logic and I had to --force-depends to install, and even then it refused to load the kernel module for me. Sorry, but I can't help. All I can suggest is that you try to reinstall the deb package if you have upgraded your kernel since the first time you installed the package
thanks for your help
